de.eckhartarnold.client

Class CaptionOverlay

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.eckhartarnold.client.CaptionOverlay
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AttachmentListener, ResizeListener, SlideshowListener

    public class CaptionOverlay
extends java.lang.Object
implements SlideshowListener, ResizeListener, AttachmentListener
    Encapsulates a caption in a transparent pop-up window over the image panel.

    For better visibility, a shadow is added to the text (by placing under the overlay popup a second overlay popup with the same caption text but in black color and slightly moved to the lower right direction). Note: The CaptionOverlay should be added as WindowListener only after the caption itself has been added!

    • Constructor Detail

      • CaptionOverlay

        public CaptionOverlay(Caption caption,
              Widget baseWidget,
              Slideshow slideshow,
              java.lang.String position)
        Creates a new overlay caption. An overlay caption is laid over some other widget, which is usually the FlipImagePanel which displays the slides.
        Parameters:
        caption - the caption which shall be overlaid
        baseWidget - the base widget over which the caption shall be overlaid
        slideshow - the slide show to which the captioned images belong

      • CaptionOverlay

        protected CaptionOverlay(Caption caption,
              Widget baseWidget,
              Slideshow slideshow,
              java.lang.String position,
              boolean dropShadow)
        Creates the shadow for an overlay caption. With this constructor the CaptionOverlay object functions as shadow. The difference to a normal CaptionOverlay object is that a shadow does not listen to the Slideshow events and that a shadow does not itself have a shadow (of course!).
        Parameters:
        caption - the caption which shall be overlaid
        baseWidget - the base widget over which the caption shall be overlaid (usually an image panel)
        slideshow - the slide show to which the captioned images belong
        dropShadow - this parameter is only meant for differentiating the shadow constructor from the normal constructor. No matter what the value of this parameter is, an overlay object created with this constructor will always be a shadow!

      • prepareResized

        public void prepareResized()
        Description copied from interface: ResizeListener
        Called after a parent widget has been resized, but before the new size is processed via onResized. The method prepareResized is needed to allow composite widgets that contain absolute panels to temporarily detach these absolute panels in order to allow the browser to calculate widget sizes correctly. The implementation of onResized can then re-attach the detached absolute panels. Methods prepareResized and onResized should therefore always be used in conjunction.
        Specified by:
        prepareResized in interface ResizeListener

        public void setShowAtTop(boolean showAtTop)
        Tells the CaptionOverlay whether the caption shall be shown at the top or at the bottom of the image.
        Parameters:
        showAtTop - true, if the caption is to be shown at the top
